channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kenya launched a fertilizer subsidy in 2008 and now farmers say the soil is dying and chemical fertilizers that make the land acidic are to blame
item.description: About 63% of arable land in Kenya is now acidic, according to the agriculture ministry, which has been recording a decline in production of staples such as maize and leading exports of horticulture and tea.

item.title: World shatters heat record for the second time in just two days
item.description: The world registered its hottest day on record for the second time in just two days, according to the latest data compiled by the EU's climate monitor.

item.title: AT&T matched expectations on earnings but beat on these two key measures
A quarter of bosses admit their return-to-office mandates were meant to make staff quit
item.description: The report from BambooHR concludes what many workers have long suspected: RTO mandates are layoffs in disguise.

item.title: AT&T beats estimates for subscriber additions on demand for higher-priced plans
item.description: AT&T exceeded market expectations for wireless subscriber additions in the second quarter on Wednesday, as higher-tier unlimited plans attracted customers.

item.title: Salt Lake City to host Winter Games for second time
Budget airline EasyJet sells an extra 1.5 million tickets with profits up 16% as its summer looks vastly different from struggling rival Ryanair
item.description: EasyJet’s CEO Johan Lundgren said the company was “on track to deliver another record-breaking summer.”

item.title: Wednesday's analyst calls: Alphabet, Tesla earnings reaction, Goldman upgrades Spotify
item.description: Two tech stocks were among the names being talked about by analysts on Wednesday.

item.title: LVMH shares slump on signs the post-COVID luxury boom is over
Explosion and fire at Mexican tequila factory kills at least 5
item.description: Víctor Hugo Roldán, the state Civil Protection director, said two of the factory's 219,000-liter tequila vats ruptured and authorities were working to ensure no alcohol spilled into the municipal drainage network.

item.title: Tesla shares fall 7% in premarket trading after earnings miss
item.description: Tesla shares fell more in premarket trading in the U.S. after it reported second-quarter earnings that missed expectations.

item.title: German manufacturing slumps, eurozone economy listless in July
Donald Trump told the Fed not to cut rates before the election—but Wall Street is convinced he won’t get his way
item.description: "The market is now pricing in more than two 25-basis-point rate cuts by year-end, including a near-100% chance of a September cut."

item.title: World's largest luxury group LVMH slumps 4% after second-quarter revenue miss
item.description: Shares in LVMH fell on Wednesday after the luxury group on Tuesday released its earnings for the first half of 2024.

item.title: Bond yields dip as investors seek safety after Tesla, Alphabet results
